testcase.name: NTI Subscriber DHCP L3Relay
testcase.summary:
Tips for rewrite: Have tester record type of ARP mode used (ARP mode and VLANs used can be random), Traffic needs to be spefied as ARP, DHCP, IGMP and data packets (IE HTTP, PING, RTP or Video)

Setup:
Configure Ethernet sub port on with an Access-profile with DHCP mode L3Relay.
Set up NTI for internal.

Testing Steps:
1. Have device DHCP an address and send traffic
2. Turn on NTI.
3. Check that traffic is been trapped and still been sent.
4. Turn off NTI.
5. Make sure traffic can still be sent.
6. Turn on NTI.
7. Have device release IP address and renew its address.
8. Make sure traffic can still be sent and is been captured.

Repeat the above testing with NTI mode, local and remote.

Setup:
Configure Ethernet sub port on with an Access-profile with DHCP mode L3Relay.
Set up NTI for internal.

Testing Steps:
1. Have device DHCP an address and send traffic
2. Turn on NTI.
3. Check that traffic is been trapped and still been sent.
4. Turn off NTI.
5. Make sure traffic can still be sent.
6. Turn on NTI.
7. Have device release IP address and renew its address.
8. Make sure traffic can still be sent and is been captured.

Repeat the above testing with NTI mode, local and remote.
testcase.preconditions: Ethernet Subscriber blade and NID and PC to DHCP with, traffic generation tools. NTI machine for remote capturing. DHCP server.

testcase.name: NTI Subscriber ARP mode Proxy
testcase.summary:
Tips for rewrite: Have tester record type of DHCP mode used (DHCP mode and VLANs used can be random), Traffic needs to be spefied as ARP, DHCP, IGMP and data packets (IE HTTP, PING, RTP or Video)

SSetup:
Configure Ethernet sub port on with an Access-profile with ARP mode Proxy.
Set up NTI for internal.

Testing Steps:
1. Have device ARP out into the network and send traffic
2. Turn on NTI.
3. Check that traffic is been trapped and still been sent.
4. Turn off NTI.
5. Make sure traffic can still be sent.
6. Turn on NTI.
7. Have device send out an arp to a new device.
8. Make sure traffic can still be sent and is been captured.

Repeat the above testing with NTI mode, local and remote.

SSetup:
Configure Ethernet sub port on with an Access-profile with ARP mode Proxy.
Set up NTI for internal.

Testing Steps:
1. Have device ARP out into the network and send traffic
2. Turn on NTI.
3. Check that traffic is been trapped and still been sent.
4. Turn off NTI.
5. Make sure traffic can still be sent.
6. Turn on NTI.
7. Have device send out an arp to a new device.
8. Make sure traffic can still be sent and is been captured.

Repeat the above testing with NTI mode, local and remote.
testcase.preconditions: Ethernet Subscriber blade and NID and STB with TV, traffic generation tools. NTI machine for remote capturing.

testcase.name: NTI Subscriber Access Lists
testcase.summary:
Tips for rewrite: Have tester record type of ARP mode and DHCP mode used (ARP and DHCP mode and VLANs used can be random), Traffic needs to be spefied as ARP, DHCP, IGMP and data packets (IE HTTP, PING, RTP or Video)

*when creating a nti profile for a dsl port make sure to specify both the dsl port and the service. If the service is not specified, locally trapped traffic (dhcp/arp/igmp) will not be displayed in the captureSetup:
BLC with DSL ports and No T1s
Configure Access Lists.
access-list ip 1 permit associations
access-list ip 2 deny 200.0.0.0

Testing Steps:
1. Assign access-list 1 to same vlan as your DSL Subscriber
2. Turn on NTI.
3. Check that traffic is been trapped and still been sent.
4. Turn off NTI.
5. Make sure traffic can still be sent.
6. Turn on NTI.
7. Assign access-list 2 to same vlan as your DSLSubscriber.
8. Make sure traffic can still be sent and is been captured.

Repeat the above testing with NTI mode, local and remote.

*when creating a nti profile for a dsl port make sure to specify both the dsl port and the service. If the service is not specified, locally trapped traffic (dhcp/arp/igmp) will not be displayed in the captureSetup:
BLC with DSL ports and No T1s
Configure Access Lists.
access-list ip 1 permit associations
access-list ip 2 deny 200.0.0.0

Testing Steps:
1. Assign access-list 1 to same vlan as your DSL Subscriber
2. Turn on NTI.
3. Check that traffic is been trapped and still been sent.
4. Turn off NTI.
5. Make sure traffic can still be sent.
6. Turn on NTI.
7. Assign access-list 2 to same vlan as your DSLSubscriber.
8. Make sure traffic can still be sent and is been captured.

Repeat the above testing with NTI mode, local and remote.
testcase.preconditions: BLC with DSL ports and No T1s and PC to DHCP with, traffic generation tools. NTI machine for remote capturing. DHCP server.
